posts.post_content:
[Equilibrium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Equilibrium) Is not infinite mana, unless I'm bad with the rules.  
To my understanding, when you cast Priest, the ability from Equilibrium goes on the stack and while that ability is on the stack, Priest is NOT on the battlefield. Please correct me if I'm wrong.

posts.post_content: I've been wanting to kick a [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication) on one of these to fuel a kicked [Sadistic Sacrament](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sadistic Sacrament) and a [Mind Sludge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Sludge). There are obviously more powerful things to use it for ([Drain Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drain Life), among others), but the capacity for destroying my opponent's hand and library that come with this greatly appeals to me.

posts.post_content: Obviously he's free, and yet you can infinite mana with him, but from the perspective we're supposed to look at him from; He can be splashed into a deck to give you three black at a time. So in your red, green, black, jund deck you can hold him in your hand and convert ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) into ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) to hard cast your [Gravepact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravepact).
posts.html:
Obviously he's free, and yet you can infinite mana with him, but from the perspective we're supposed to look at him from; He can be splashed into a deck to give you three black at a time. So in your red, green, black, jund deck you can hold him in your hand and convert into to hard cast your Gravepact.

Turn one; [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) this guy [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk)
